intro: Hydropectis, commonly known as the water pellitory, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. These plants typically have aromatic, pinnately divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. They are often found in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes and stream banks. Hydropectis species are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
